title: The Writer's Almanac - Monday, April 5, 2021
description: Dr. Hattie Alexander was born in Baltimore (1901). An American pediatrician and microbiologist who developed the vaccine, known as Hib, to prevent influenzal meningitis.
itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
